1059142_13_ITEM1A_P84_S0	There are limits on the ability of our unitholders to deduct Partnership losses and expenses allocated to them.
1059142_13_ITEM1A_P85_S0	The ability of unitholders to deduct their proportionate share of the losses and expenses generated by the Partnership will be limited in certain cases, and certain transactions may result in the triggering of the Alternative Minimum Tax for unitholders who are individuals.
1059142_13_ITEM2_P0_S0	Each of the Partnership's tax-exempt mortgage revenue bonds is collateralized by a multifamily housing property.
1059142_13_ITEM2_P0_S1	The Partnership does not hold title or any other interest in these properties, other than the mortgages securing the bonds.
1059142_13_ITEM2_P1_S0	As a result of the guidance on consolidations, the Company is required to consolidate certain of the multifamily residential properties securing its bonds because the owners of those properties are treated as Consolidated VIEs for which the Company is the primary beneficiary.
1059142_13_ITEM2_P1_S1	As of December 31, 2012 , the Company consolidated four multifamily housing properties owned by VIEs located in Florida, Nebraska and South Carolina.
1059142_13_ITEM2_P1_S2	The Partnership does not hold title to the properties owned by the VIEs.
1059142_13_ITEM2_P1_S3	Due to a Master Lease Agreement executed between the Partnership and the owner of the Maples on 97th property, the results from operations of that property are included in the MF Properties footnote and in the consolidated statement of operations.
1059142_13_ITEM2_P2_S0	In addition to the properties owned by Consolidated VIEs, the Company reports the financial results of the MF Properties on a consolidated basis due to the limited partnership interests held by its subsidiary in the partnerships that own the MF Properties.
1059142_13_ITEM2_P2_S1	The Company consolidated eleven MF Properties located in Nebraska, Kentucky, Indiana, Georgia, North Carolina, Texas, and Ohio as of December 31, 2012 .
1059142_13_ITEM2_P2_S2	The three Ohio Properties and the Greens Property in North Carolina are reported as discontinued operations (see Note 10 to the consolidated financial statements).
1059142_13_ITEM2_P3_S0	The following table sets forth certain information for each of the consolidated properties as of December 31, 2012 :
1059142_13_ITEM2_P4_S0	(1) Due to a Master Lease Agreement between the Partnership and the EAT, the results from operations of the Maples on 97th property are included in the MF Properties segment.
1059142_13_ITEM2_P4_S1	(2) The construction work in process represents pre-development architecture and engineering costs related to a 475 bed student housing project to be built above a 1,605 parking stall garage to be constructed at the University of Nebraska-Lincoln.
1059142_13_ITEM3_P0_S0	There are no pending legal proceedings to which the Partnership is a party or to which any of the properties collateralizing the Partnership's tax-exempt mortgage revenue bonds are subject.
1059142_13_ITEM5_P0_S0	BUCs represent assignments by the sole limited partner of its rights and obligations as a limited partner.
1059142_13_ITEM5_P0_S1	The rights and obligations of unitholders are set forth in the Partnership's Agreement of Limited Partnership.
1059142_13_ITEM5_P1_S0	BUCs of the Partnership trade on the NASDAQ Global Market under the trading symbol "ATAX".
1059142_13_ITEM5_P1_S1	The following table sets forth the high and low sale prices for the BUCs for each quarterly period from January 1, 2011 through December 31, 2012 .
1059142_13_ITEM5_P2_S0	The approximate number of unitholders on December 31, 2012 was 11,778.
1059142_13_ITEM5_P3_S0	Distributions to unitholders were made on a quarterly basis during 2012 , 2011 , and 2010 .
1059142_13_ITEM5_P3_S1	Total distributions for the years ended December 31, 2012 , 2011 , and 2010 were approximately $20,643,000, $15,061,000, and $13,574,000, respectively.

1059142_13_ITEM5_P6_S0	(f) Issuer Purchases of Equity Securities.
1059142_13_ITEM6_P0_S0	Set forth below is selected financial data for the Company as of and for the years ended December 31, 2008 through 2012 .
1059142_13_ITEM6_P0_S1	The information should be read in conjunction with the Company's consolidated financial statements and notes thereto filed in response to Item 8 of this report.
1059142_13_ITEM6_P0_S2	Please refer to the discussions in Item 1 and Item 7 regarding the implementation of guidance on consolidations and it's effects on the presentation of financial data in this report on Form10-K:
1059142_13_ITEM6_P1_S0	Please refer to the discussions in Item 1 and Item 7 regarding the implementation of guidance on consolidations and it's effects on the presentation of financial data in this report on Form10-K (continued):
1059142_13_ITEM6_P2_S0	(1) To calculate CAD, amortization expense related to debt financing costs and bond reissuance costs, Tier 2 income due to the general partner (as defined in the Agreement of Limited Partnership), interest rate derivative income or expense (including adjustments to fair value), provision for loan losses, provision for loss on receivables, impairments on assets, deferred gain and related interest, bond discount amortization net of cash received, losses related to consolidated VIEs, and depreciation and amortization expense on MF Property assets are added back to the Company's net income (loss) as computed in accordance with GAAP.
1059142_13_ITEM6_P3_S0	The Company uses CAD as a supplemental measurement of its ability to pay distributions.
1059142_13_ITEM6_P3_S1	The Company believes that CAD provides relevant information about its operations and is necessary along with net income (loss) for understanding its operating results.
1059142_13_ITEM6_P4_S0	Management utilizes a calculation of CAD as a means to determine the Partnership's ability to make distributions to unitholders.
1059142_13_ITEM6_P4_S1	The General Partner believes that CAD provides relevant information about the Partnership's operations and is necessary along with net income for understanding its operating results.
1059142_13_ITEM6_P4_S2	There is no generally accepted methodology for computing CAD, and the Partnership's computation of CAD may not be comparable to CAD reported by other companies.
1059142_13_ITEM6_P4_S3	Although the Partnership considers CAD to be a useful measure of its operating performance, CAD should not be considered as an alternative to net income or net cash flows from operating activities which are calculated in accordance with GAAP.
1059142_13_ITEM6_P5_S0	The following sets forth a reconciliation of the Company's net income (loss) as determined in accordance with GAAP and the Partnership's CAD for the periods set forth.
1059142_13_ITEM6_P6_S0	(1) As described in Note 2 to the consolidated financial statements, Net Interest Income representing contingent interest and Net Residual Proceeds representing contingent interest (Tier 2 income) will be distributed 75% to the unitholders and 25% to the General Partner.
1059142_13_ITEM6_P6_S1	This adjustment represents the 25% of Tier 2 income due to the General Partner.
1059142_13_ITEM6_P6_S2	For the year ended 2012, the Tier 2 income is approximately $557K recognized on the Arbors at Hickory Ridge mortgage revenue bond re-structuring, $668K recognized on the GMF-Madison and GMF-Warren/Tulane tax exempt revenue bond sale and $1.4 million recognized on the sale of the MF Properties.
1059142_13_ITEM6_P6_S3	For the year ended December 31, 2011, the Tier 2 income is approximately $445K recognized on the Briarwood tax-exempt mortgage revenue bond retirement and approximately $308K of contingent interest recognized upon the Clarkson tax-exempt mortgage revenue bond retirement.
1059142_13_ITEM6_P6_S4	For the second quarter of 2010, the deferred gain on the sale of the Ohio Properties generated approximately $1.8 million and contingent interest generated approximately $33K of Tier 2 income.
1059142_13_ITEM6_P6_S5	For 2009, the Tier 2 income distributable to the General Partner was generated by the early redemption of Woodbridge - Bloomington and Woodbridge - Louisville tax-exempt mortgage revenue bond investments, the sale of Oak Grove, and contingent interest received from Fairmont Oaks and Lake Forest Apartments.
1059142_13_ITEM6_P6_S6	For 2008, Lake Forest generated approximately $45,000, Fairmont Oaks generated approximately $54,000, and Iona Lakes generated approximately $54,000 of Tier 2 income.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P0_S0	In this Management's Discussion and Analysis, the Partnership refers to America First Tax Exempt Investors, L.P. and its Consolidated Subsidiaries which consist of:
1059142_13_ITEM7_P1_S0	Financing with Freddie Mac (See Notes 2 and 11 to the consolidated financial statements).
1059142_13_ITEM7_P2_S0	Seven multifamily apartments ("MF Properties") of which six are owned by various Partnership subsidiaries.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P2_S1	Such subsidiaries hold a 99% limited partner interest in three limited partnerships and 100% member positions in four limited liability companies.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P2_S2	The seventh MF Property is Maples on 97th whose operating results are reported by the Partnership as a result of a Master Lease Agreement between the Partnership and the owner of that property (See Note 4 to the consolidated financial statements).
1059142_13_ITEM7_P3_S0	Four apartment properties are reported as discontinued operations (See Note 10 to the consolidated financial statements).
1059142_13_ITEM7_P4_S0	The Company refers to the consolidated financial statements reported in this Form 10-K which include the assets, liabilities, and results of operations of the Partnership, its Consolidated Subsidiaries and three other consolidated entities in which the Partnership does not hold an ownership interest but which own multifamily apartment properties financed with tax-exempt mortgage revenue bonds held by the Partnership and which are treated as variable interest entities ("VIEs") of which the Partnership has been determined to be the primary beneficiary ( Consolidated VIEs ).
1059142_13_ITEM7_P4_S1	All significant transactions and accounts between the Partnership and the VIEs have been eliminated in consolidation.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P5_S0	On December 31, 2012 , the Partnership owned 22 federally tax-exempt mortgage revenue bonds with an aggregate outstanding principal amount of $198.6 million.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P5_S1	These bonds were issued by various state and local housing authorities in order to provide construction and/or permanent financing of 20 multifamily residential apartments containing a total of 3,880 rental units located in the states of Florida, Illinois, Iowa, Kansas, Kentucky, Minnesota, North Carolina, Ohio, South Carolina, Tennessee, and Texas.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P5_S2	In each case the Partnership owns, either directly or indirectly, 100% of the bonds issued for these properties.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P5_S3	Each bond is secured by a mortgage or deed of trust on the financed apartment property.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P5_S4	The properties underlying the fourteen non-consolidated tax-exempt mortgage revenue bonds contain a total of 2,700 rental units at December 31, 2012 .
1059142_13_ITEM7_P5_S5	Two bonds secured by the three Ohio Properties containing 362 rental units and two bonds secured by the Greens Property containing 168 rental units are eliminated in consolidation in the Company's financial statement (see Note 3 to the consolidated financial statements) and the multifamily apartment properties are reported as discontinued operations.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P5_S6	As of December 31, 2011 , the properties underlying the fifteen non-consolidated tax-exempt mortgage revenue bonds contain a total of 2,947 rental units.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P6_S0	The tax-exempt bond segment reported revenue of approximately $12.2 million, interest expense of approximately $3.5 million and income from continuing operations of approximately $4.1 million for the year ended December 31, 2012.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P6_S1	The tax-exempt bond investments segment reported revenue of approximately $12.6 million and $11.1 million, interest expense of approximately $4.5 million and $1.8 million and loss from continuing operations of approximately $0.4 million versus income from continuing operations of approximately $2.4 million for the years ended December 31, 2011 and 2010.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P6_S2	The majority of the increase in income from continuing operations between 2011 to 2012 resulted from a $4.2 million impairment of the Iona Lakes taxable loan in 2011 and no taxable loan impairments in 2012.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P6_S3	The remaining reason for the increase is due to the non-cash change in the fair value of the interest rate derivatives; which was a loss of $2.1 million and approximately $945,000 in 2011 and 2012, respectively.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P6_S4	The approximately $2.7 million change in income from operations between 2011 versus 2010 can also be attributed to the $4.2 million impairment of the Iona Lakes taxable loan in 2011 versus an approximately $560,000 impairment of the Woodland Park and Ashley Square/Cross Creek cross-collateralized loans offset by the additional $1.5 million of revenue attributed to additional bonds purchased in 2011.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P7_S0	The three Consolidated VIE multifamily apartment properties as of December 31, 2012 and 2011, contained a total of 650 rental units.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P8_S0	During 2012, the Company invested in other types of tax-exempt securities.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P8_S1	In accordance with the terms of the Agreement of Limited Partners, these tax-exempt securities must be rated in one of the four highest rating categories by at least one nationally recognized securities rating agency and may not represent more than 25% of the Partnership's assets at the time of acquisition.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P9_S0	Public Housing Capital Fund Trusts' Certificates ("PHC Certificates") .
1059142_13_ITEM7_P9_S1	The PHC Certificates, acquired during 2012, consist of custodial receipts evidencing loans made to a number of public housing authorities.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P9_S2	Principal and interest on these loans are payable by the respective public housing authorities out of annual appropriations to be made to the public housing authorities by HUD under HUD's Capital Fund Program.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P9_S3	At December 31, 2012, the Company owns PHC Certificates with an aggregate outstanding principal amount of $65.3 million.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P9_S4	The Public Housing Capital Fund Trust Certificates segment reported revenue of approximately $1.6 million, interest expense of approximately $542,000, and income from continuing operations of $1 million for the year ending December 31, 2012.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P10_S0	As of December, 31, 2012, the Company owns ten state-issued MBS with an aggregate outstanding principal amount of $31.6 million.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P10_S1	The MBS were acquired during the fourth quarter of 2012 and are backed by residential mortgage loans.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P10_S2	The Mortgage-backed securities segment reported revenue of approximately $194,000, interest expense of approximately $39,000, and income from continuing operations of $149,000 for the year ending December 31, 2012.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P11_S0	To facilitate its investment strategy of acquiring additional tax-exempt mortgage revenue bonds secured by multifamily apartment properties, the Partnership may acquire ownership positions in MF Properties, in order to ultimately restructure the property ownership through a sale of the MF Properties.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P11_S1	The Partnership expects each of these MF Properties to eventually be sold to a not-for-profit entity or in connection with a syndication of LIHTCs under Section 42 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended (the Internal Revenue Code ).
1059142_13_ITEM7_P11_S2	The Partnership expects to acquire tax-exempt mortgage revenue bonds issued to provide debt financing for these properties at the time the property ownership is restructured.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P11_S3	The Partnership expects to provide the tax-exempt mortgage revenue bonds to the new property owners as part of the restructuring.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P12_S0	As of December 31, 2012, the Partnership s wholly-owned subsidiaries held interests in three entities that own MF Properties containing a total of 504 rental units.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P12_S1	In addition, the Partnership's subsidiaries own four MF Properties, Arboretum, DeCordova, Eagle Village and Weatherford containing a total of 842 rental units.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P12_S2	The MF Properties' operating goal is similar to that of the properties underlying the Partnership's tax-exempt mortgage revenue bonds.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P12_S3	As of December 31, 2011, the Partnership s wholly-owned subsidiaries held interests in five entities that own MF Properties containing a total of 602 rental units which includes the Greens of Pine property, Eagle Ridge, and Commons atof which six Churchland property which were all legally sold in 2012.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P12_S4	Also as of December 31, 2011, the Partnership's subsidiaries own four MF Properties, Arboretum, DeCordova, Eagle Village and Weatherford.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P12_S5	Arboretum, Eagle Village and DeCordova contain a total of 732 rental units and the construction of 76 units was in process at Weatherford as of December 31, 2011 (see Note 2 and Note 8 to the consolidated financial statements).
1059142_13_ITEM7_P13_S0	The MF Properties segment reported revenue of approximately $7.8 million and $5.1 million and a loss from continuing operations of approximately $1.1 million and $783,000 for the years ended December 31, 2012 and 2011.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P13_S1	The increase in revenue is due to having a full years worth of revenue from the Arboretum and Eagle Village properties which were acquired during 2011 and the Maples on 97th property which was acquired in August 2012.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P13_S2	This increase in revenue was more than offset by an increase in real estate operating expenses and depreciation expense also attributed to these acquired properties as well as real estate operating expenses and depreciation expense from the Weatherford property which finalized construction during the first half of 2012 and is in lease-up at December 31, 2012.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P14_S0	As of December 31, 2012 , the Partnership s wholly-owned subsidiaries held interests in three Ohio Properties containing 362 rental units and the Greens Property containing 168 rental units which are reported as discontinued operations (see Note 2 and Note 10 to the consolidated financial statements).
1059142_13_ITEM7_P14_S1	The income (loss) from discontinued operations was approximately $2.2 million in 2012, $752,000 in 2011, and $(470,000) in 2010.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P14_S2	The increase in income between 2011 and 2012 can be attributed to the $1.4 million gain realized from the sales of the Commons at Churchland and Eagle Ridge properties in 2012.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P14_S3	The change from loss to income from 2010 to 2011 can be attributed to the one-time payment in 2010 of AFCA 2 fees by the Ohio Properties and other costs related to the sale of the Ohio Properties.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P15_S0	During 2012, the Company closed on eight new TOB Trusts all issued under the terms of the Company's Master Trust Agreement with DB.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P15_S1	At December 31, 2012, the Company owes approximately $49.0 million under three TOB Trusts which are securitized by PHC Certificates ("PHC TOB Trusts") with outstanding principal balance of approximately $65.3 million, owes approximately $25.1 million under five TOB Trusts which are securitized by mortgage-backed securities ("MBS TOB Trusts") with a par value of approximately $31.6 million, and owes approximately $9.8 million securitized by a $13.2 million tax-exempt mortgage revenue bond (see Note 11 to the consolidated financial statements).
1059142_13_ITEM7_P16_S0	As of December 31, 2012 , the total cost of borrowing for the PHC Certificates TOB facility was 2.13% and the weighted average cost of borrowing on the five TOB facilities securitizing mortgage-backed securities was approximately 2.17%.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P16_S1	The Company's total cost of borrowing under the Autumn Pines TOB is 2.71% as of December 31, 2012.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P16_S2	The Company is accounting for these TOB transactions as secured financing arrangements.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P17_S0	Tax Exempt Bond Securitization ("TEBS") Financing.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P17_S1	As of September 1, 2010, the Partnership and its Consolidated Subsidiary ATAX TEBS I, LLC, entered into a number of agreements relating to along-term debt financing facility provided through the securitization of 13 tax-exempt mortgage revenue bonds pursuant to Freddie Mac's TEBS program.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P17_S2	The gross proceeds from TEBS Financing were approximately $95.8 million.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P17_S3	After the payment of transaction expenses, the Company received net proceeds from the TEBS Financing of approximately $90.4 million and the Company owes approximately $94.0 million at December 31, 2012 (see Note 11 to the consolidated financial statements).
1059142_13_ITEM7_P18_S0	The TEBS Financing essentially provides the Company with a long-term variable-rate debt facility at interest rates reflecting prevailing short-term tax-exempt rates.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P18_S1	As of December 31, 2012 , the total cost of borrowing was 2.03% for the TEBS facility.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P18_S2	As of December 31, 2011 , the total cost of borrowing for the TEBS was 2.05%.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P19_S0	The disruptions in domestic and international financial markets, and the resulting availability of debt financing has improved since the restrictions seen in 2008.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P19_S1	While economic trends show signs of a stabilization of the economy and debt availability has increased, overall availability remains limited and the cost of credit may continue to be adversely impacted.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P19_S2	These conditions, in our view, will continue to create potential investment opportunities for the Partnership.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P19_S3	We believe this continues to create opportunities to acquire existing tax-exempt bonds from distressed holders at attractive yields.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P19_S4	The Partnership continues to evaluate potential investments in bonds which are available on the secondary market.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P19_S5	We believe many of these bonds will meet our investment criteria and that we have a unique ability to analyze and close on these opportunities while maintaining our ability and willingness to also participate in primary market transactions.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P20_S0	Current credit and real estate market conditions also create opportunities to acquire quality MF Properties from distressed owners and lenders.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P20_S1	Our ability to restructure existing debt together with the ability to improve the operations of the apartment properties through our affiliated property management company can position these MF Properties for an eventual financing with tax-exempt mortgage revenue bonds meeting our investment criteria and that will be supported by a valuable and well-run apartment property.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P20_S2	We believe we can selectively acquire MF Properties, restructure debt and improve operations in order to create value to our unitholders in the form of a strong tax-exempt bond investment.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P21_S0	On the other hand, continued economic weakness in some markets may limit our ability to access additional debt financing that the Partnership uses to partially finance its investment portfolio or otherwise meet its liquidity requirements.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P21_S1	In addition, the economic conditions including a slow job growth and low home mortgage interest rates have had a negative effect on some of the apartment properties which collateralize our tax-exempt bond investments and our MF Properties in the form of lower occupancy.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P21_S2	While some properties have been negatively effected, overall economic occupancy (which is adjusted to reflect rental concessions, delinquent rents and non-revenue units such as model units and employee units) of the apartment properties that the Partnership has financed with tax-exempt mortgage revenue bonds was approximately at 86% during 2012 as compared to 85% during 2011 .
1059142_13_ITEM7_P21_S3	Overall economic occupancy of the MF Properties has remained the same at approximately 76% during 2012 and 2011 .
1059142_13_ITEM7_P21_S4	Based on the growth statistics in the market, we expect to see continued improvement in property operations and profitability.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P21_S5	We expect that property operations will improve in 2013 and that rental rate and occupancy trends will be continue to be positive.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P22_S0	The following discussion describes the operations and financial results of the individual apartment properties financed by the tax-exempt mortgage revenue bonds held by the Partnership and the MF Properties in which it holds an ownership.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P22_S1	The discussion also outlines the bond holdings of the Partnership, discusses the significant terms of the bonds and identifies those ownership entities which are Consolidated VIEs of the Company.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P23_S0	(1) Economic occupancy is presented for the twelve months ended December 31, 2012 and 2011 , and is defined as the net rental income received divided by the maximum amount of rental income to be derived from each property.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P23_S1	This statistic is reflective of rental concessions, delinquent rents and non-revenue units such as model units and employee units.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P23_S2	Actual occupancy is a point in time measure while economic occupancy is a measurement over the period presented, therefore, economic occupancy for a period may exceed the actual occupancy at any point in time.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P23_S3	(2) Previous period occupancy numbers are not available, as this is a new investment.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P23_S4	(3) Construction on these properties has been completed and the properties are in a lease up and stabilization period.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P24_S0	The owners of the following properties do not meet the definition of a VIE and/or the Partnership has evaluated and determined it is not the primary beneficiary of the VIE, as a result, the Company does not report the assets, liabilities and results of operations of these properties on a consolidated basis.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P25_S0	Arbors of Hickory Ridge - Arbors of Hickory Ridge Apartments is located in Memphis, Tennessee and contains 348 units.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P25_S1	The tax-exempt mortgage revenue bond owned by the Partnership was sponsored by the 501(c)3 not-for-profit owner of Arbors of Hickory Ridge.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P25_S2	The tax-exempt mortgage revenue bond has an outstanding principal amount of $11.5 million and has a base interest rate of 6.25% per annum.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P25_S3	The bond does not provide for contingent interest.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P25_S4	This bond was purchased at par in December 2012.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P25_S5	Arbors of Hickory Ridge's operations resulted in net operating income of $568,000 before payment of bond debt service on net revenue of approximately $1.23 million in 2012.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P25_S6	The property is current on the payment of principal and interest on the Partnership's bond as of December 31, 2012.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P26_S0	Ashley Square - Ashley Square Apartments is located in Des Moines, Iowa and contains 144 units.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P27_S0	The tax-exempt mortgage revenue bond owned by the Partnership is a traditional 80/20 bond issued prior to the Tax Reform Act of 1986.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P27_S1	This bond requires that 20% of the rental units be set aside for tenants whose income does not exceed 80% of the area median income, without adjustment for household size.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P27_S2	The bond has an outstanding principal amount of $5.3 million and has a base interest rate of 6.25% per annum.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P27_S3	The bond also provides for contingent interest payable from excess cash flow generated by the underlying property through the potential payment of contingent interest.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P27_S4	The bond accrues contingent interest at a rate of 3.0% annually and such contingent interest is payable only if the underlying property generates excess operating cash flows or realizes excess cash through capital appreciation and a related sale or refinancing of the property.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P27_S5	To date, the property has not paid any contingent interest and the Partnership has not recognized any contingent interest income related to this bond.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P27_S6	Ashley Square's operations resulted in net operating income of $644,000 and $663,000 before payment of bond debt service on net revenue of approximately $1.36 million and $1.38 million in 2012 and 2011, respectively.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P27_S7	The decrease in net operating income is the result of an increase in administrative expenses and an increase in real estate taxes.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P27_S8	The property is current on the payment of principal and base interest on the Partnership's bond as of December 31, 2012.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P28_S0	Autumn Pines - Autumn Pines is located in Humble, Texas and contains 250 units.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P29_S0	The tax-exempt mortgage revenue bond owned by the Partnership is a private activity housing bond issued in conjunction with the syndication of LIHTCs.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P29_S1	The bond has an outstanding principal amount of $13.2 million and has a base interest rate of 5.8% per annum.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P29_S2	The bond does not provide for contingent interest.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P29_S3	The bond was purchased in November 2010 at a discount from par for approximately $12.3 million providing an approximate effective yield to maturity of 7.0%.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P29_S4	Autumn Pines' operations resulted in net operating income of $1.24 million and $1.19 million before payment of bond debt service on net revenue of approximately $2.39 million and $2.38 million in 2012 and 2011, respectively.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P29_S5	The improvement in net operating income from 2011 is primarily the result of an increase in economic occupancy.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P29_S6	The property is current on principal and interest payments on the Partnership's bond as of December 31, 2012 .
1059142_13_ITEM7_P30_S0	Bella Vista - Bella Vista Apartments is located in Gainesville, Texas and contains 144 units.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P31_S0	The tax-exempt mortgage revenue bond owned by the Partnership is a private activity housing bond issued in conjunction with the syndication of LIHTCs.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P31_S1	The bond has an outstanding principal amount of $6.6 million and has a base interest rate of 6.15% per annum.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P31_S2	The bond does not provide for contingent interest.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P32_S0	Bella Vista's operations resulted in net operating income of $639,000 and $583,000 before payment of debt service on net revenue of approximately $1.17 million and $1.12 million in 2012 and 2011 , respectively.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P32_S1	The increases in net operating income is due to a decrease in utility and repair and maintenance expenses and the increase in revenue is due to higher average rents.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P32_S2	The property is current on principal and interest payments on the Partnership's bond as of December 31, 2012 .
1059142_13_ITEM7_P33_S0	Bridle Ridge - Bridle Ridge Apartments is located in Greer, South Carolina and contains 152 units.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P34_S0	The tax-exempt mortgage revenue bond owned by the Partnership is a private activity housing bond issued in conjunction with the syndication of LIHTCs.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P34_S1	The bond has an outstanding principal amount of $7.8 million and a base interest rate of 6.0% per annum.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P34_S2	The bond does not provide for contingent interest.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P34_S3	Bridle Ridge's operations resulted in net operating income of approximately $717,000 and $702,000 before payment of bond debt service on net revenue of approximately $1.14 million and $1.06 million in 2012 and 2011 , respectively.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P34_S4	The increase in net operating income is due to an increase in economic occupancy.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P34_S5	The property is current on principal and interest payments on the Partnership's bond as of December 31, 2012 .
1059142_13_ITEM7_P35_S0	Brookstone - Brookstone Apartments is located in Waukegan, Illinois and contains 168 units.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P36_S0	The tax-exempt mortgage revenue bond owned by the Partnership is a private activity housing bond issued in conjunction with the syndication of LIHTCs.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P36_S1	The bond has an outstanding principal amount of $9.4 million and a base interest rate of 5.45% per annum.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P36_S2	The bond does not provide for contingent interest.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P37_S0	These bonds were purchased in October 2009 at a discount from par for approximately $7.3 million providing an approximate yield to maturity of 7.5%.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P37_S1	Brookstone's operations resulted in net operating income of $895,000 and $905,000 before payment of bond debt service on net revenue of approximately $1.35 million and $1.33 million in 2012 and 2011, respectively.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P37_S2	The decrease in net operating income is due to an increase in utility and salary expenses.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P37_S3	The property is current on principal and interest payments on the Partnership's bond as of December 31, 2012 .
1059142_13_ITEM7_P38_S0	Cross Creek - Cross Creek Apartments is located in Beaufort, South Carolina and contains 144 units.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P39_S0	The tax-exempt mortgage revenue bond owned by the Partnership is a private activity housing bond issued in conjunction with the syndication of LIHTCs.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P39_S1	The bond has an outstanding principal amount of $8.6 million and has a base interest rate of 6.15% per annum.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P39_S2	The bond does not provide for contingent interest.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P40_S0	These bonds were purchased in April 2009 at a discount from par for approximately $5.9 million providing an approximate yield to maturity of 7.4%.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P40_S1	Cross Creek's operations resulted in net operating income of $453,000 and $411,000 before payment of bond debt service on net revenue of approximately $1.12 million and $1.17 million in 2012 and 2011, respectively.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P40_S2	This increase in net operating income is due to a decrease in real estate taxes offset by a decrease in economic occupancy.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P40_S3	The property is current on the payment of principal and base interest on the Partnership's bond as of December 31, 2012.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P41_S0	Iona Lakes - Iona Lakes Apartments is located in Fort Myers, Florida and contains 350 units.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P42_S0	The tax-exempt mortgage revenue bond owned by the Partnership is a traditional 80/20 bond issued prior to the Tax Reform Act of 1986.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P42_S1	The bond has an outstanding principal amount of $15.5 million and has a base interest rate of 6.9% per annum.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P42_S2	The bond also provides for contingent interest payable from excess cash flow generated by the underlying property through the potential payment of contingent interest.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P42_S3	The bond accrues contingent interest at a rate of 2.6% annually and such contingent interest is payable only if the underlying property generates excess operating cash flows or realizes excess cash through capital appreciation and a related sale or refinancing of the property.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P42_S4	To date, the Partnership has realized $8,001 contingent interest income related to this bond.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P42_S5	Iona Lake's operations resulted in net operating income of $1.11 million and $1.08 million before payment of bond debt service on net revenue of approximately $2.68 million and $2.67 million in 2012 and 2011 , respectively.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P42_S6	The increase in net operating income was a result of a decrease in advertising and utility expenses.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P42_S7	The property is current on the payment of principal and base interest on the Partnership's bond as of December 31, 2012 .
1059142_13_ITEM7_P43_S0	Runnymede Apartments - Runnymede Apartments is located in Austin, Texas and contains 252 units.

1059142_13_ITEM7_P44_S1	The bond has an outstanding principal amount of $10.6 million and has a base interest rate of 6.00%.

1059142_13_ITEM7_P47_S0	Villages at Lost Creek - Villages at Lost Creek is located in San Antonio, Texas and contains 261 units.

1059142_13_ITEM7_P48_S1	The bond has an outstanding principal amount of $18.3 million and has a base interest rate of 6.25% per annum.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P48_S2	The bond does not provide for contingent interest.

1059142_13_ITEM7_P48_S4	Lost Creek's operations resulted in net operating income of approximately $1.64 million and $1.54 million before payment of bond debt service on net revenue of approximately $2.45 million and $2.42 million in 2012 and 2011, respectively.

1059142_13_ITEM7_P49_S0	Woodland Park - Woodland Park is located in Topeka, Kansas and contains 236 units.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P50_S0	The tax-exempt mortgage revenue bonds owned by the Partnership are private activity housing bonds.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P50_S1	The bonds were issued in a Series A and B. The Series A bond has an outstanding principal amount of $15.0 million and a base interest rate of 6.0% per annum.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P50_S2	The Series B bond has an outstanding principal amount of $0.7 million and a base interest rate of 8.0% per annum.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P50_S3	The bonds do not provide for contingent interest.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P50_S4	In May 2010, there were insufficient funds available to the property to meet debt service requirements and the property owner did not provide additional capital to fund the shortfall.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P50_S5	As a result, a payment default on the bonds has occurred.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P50_S6	In order to protect its investment, the Partnership issued a formal notice of default through the bond trustee and started the judicial foreclosure process.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P50_S7	On February 28, 2013, the court issued a ruling confirming the bond trustee's right to foreclose its first mortgage on the Woodland Park property and confirming that the first mortgage securing the bond is senior to mechanic's liens filed on the property.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P50_S8	and we believe the Partnership will be able to acquire title to the Woodland Property within 75 days.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P50_S9	Upon successfully taking ownership of Woodland Park, the Partnership will have the option of selling the property after converting it to 100% market-rate rents or maintaining the property as a rent restricted property and seeking to place new tax-exempt financing on the property and acquire the bonds.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P50_S10	Although the foreclosure process has taken longer than originally anticipated, the Company continues to believe that the fair value of the Woodland Park property equals or exceeds the carrying amount of the Woodland Park tax-exempt mortgage revenue bond.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P51_S0	As of December 31, 2011, the property had 215 units leased out of total available units of 236, or 91% physical occupancy.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P51_S1	As of December 31, 2012 the occupancy had decreased to 211 units leased, or 89% physical occupancy.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P51_S2	America First Properties Management Company, LLC, an affiliate of AFCA 2, provides management for this property.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P51_S3	Measures have been implemented that we believe will maintain the physical occupancy of this property at or above 89% for 2013, which will ensure ensure that net operating income is in line with what had been projected for 2013 in the most recent evaluation for other than temporary impairment.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P51_S4	Woodland's operations resulted in net operating income of $562,000 and $754,000 before payment of bond debt service on revenue of $1.61 million and $1.55 million in 2012 and 2011, respectively.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P51_S5	The decrease in operating income is due to an increase in real estate taxes, salary and administrative expenses for the year.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P51_S6	The Partnership has completed an impairment evaluation of the Woodland Park bond and concluded that no other-than-temporary impairment existed at December 31, 2012 and 2011 (see Note 2 for discussion of the Partnership's impairment testing method).
1059142_13_ITEM7_P51_S7	However, the evaluation identified that the interest receivable on the Woodland Park bond was impaired and an approximate $452,700 and $953,000 provision for loss on interest receivables was recorded in 2012 and 2011.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P51_S8	The Partnership will record an allowance and bad debt expense against the bond interest receivable accrued in the future until the Partnership acquires title to the Woodland Park property through the foreclosure process.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P52_S0	Woodlynn Village - Woodlynn Village is located in Maplewood, Minnesota and contains 59 units.

1059142_13_ITEM7_P53_S3	Woodlynn Village's operations resulted in net operating income of $399,000 and $402,000 before payment of bond debt service on net revenue of approximately $606,000 and $599,000 in 2012 and 2011 respectively.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P53_S4	The decrease in net operating income is due primarily to an increase in real estate taxes and utility expenses offset by a slight increase in economic occupancy.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P53_S5	The property is current on principal and interest payments on the Partnership's bond as of December 31, 2012 .

1059142_13_ITEM7_P54_S1	As a result, the Company reports the assets, liabilities and results of operations of these properties on a consolidated basis.

1059142_13_ITEM7_P61_S0	In February 2011, the Partnership foreclosed on the bonds secured by DeCordova and Weatherford and one of the Partnership's subsidiaries took 100% ownership interest in these limited liability companies.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P61_S1	Both properties were previously reported as Consolidated VIEs and are now are reported as MF Properties (see discussion below).
1059142_13_ITEM7_P62_S0	Seven MF Properties are owned by various Partnership subsidiaries.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P62_S1	Such subsidiaries hold a 99% limited partner interest in three limited partnerships and 100% member positions in four limited liability companies.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P62_S2	The seven properties are encumbered by mortgage loans with an aggregate principal balance of $39.1 million at December 31, 2012 .
1059142_13_ITEM7_P62_S3	The Company reports the assets, liabilities, and results of operations of these properties on a consolidated basis.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P63_S0	Arboretum - Arboretum is located in Omaha, Nebraska and contains 145 units and was acquired in March 2011, for approximately $20.4 million.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P63_S1	This is an independent senior living facility.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P63_S2	The Arboretum's operations resulted in recognition by the Company of net operating income of approximately $1.11 million on net revenue of approximately $2.47 million in 2012.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P64_S0	Eagle Village - Eagle Village Apartments is located in Evansville, Indiana and contains 511 units and was acquired in June 2011, for approximately $12.0 million.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P64_S1	This is a student housing facility.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P65_S0	Eagle Village's operations resulted in recognition by the Company of net operating income of approximately $898,000 on net revenue of approximately $1.96 million in 2012.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P66_S0	Glynn Place - Glynn Place Apartments is located in Brunswick, Georgia and contains 128 units and was acquired in October 2008.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P66_S1	Glynn Place Apartment's operations resulted in the recognition by the Company of approximately $230,000 and $267,000 of net operating income on revenue of approximately $736,000 and $742,000 during 2012 and 2011 , respectively.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P66_S2	The decrease in net operating income is due primarily to an increase in repair and maintenance expenses.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P67_S0	Maples on 97th - Maples on 97th Apartments is located in Omaha, NE and contains 258 units.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P67_S1	These apartments were acquired in August 2012 through a Qualified Exchange Accommodation Agreement and the Company records the operating results from this property as a result of a Master Lease Agreement executed with the consolidated VIE that owned the property in 2012.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P67_S2	Maples on 97th's operations resulted in the recognition by the Company of approximately $136,000 of net operating income on revenue of approximately $604,000 in 2012.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P68_S0	Meadowview - Meadowview Apartments is located in Highland Heights, Kentucky and contains 118 units and was acquired in July 2007.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P68_S1	Meadowview's operations resulted in recognition by the Company of net operating income of approximately $529,000 and $506,000 on net revenue of approximately $1.08 million and $967,000 in 2012 and 2011 , respectively.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P68_S2	The increase in net operating income is the result of a decrease in utility expenses.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P69_S0	Residences at DeCordova - This property is a senior (55+) affordable housing project located in Granbury, Texas in the Dallas-Fort Worth area.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P69_S1	The Company acquired ownership of the property through foreclosure in February 2011.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P69_S2	At this time, the Partnership is operating the 110 unit property as a market rate rental property.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P69_S3	DeCordova's operations resulted in recognition by the Company of net operating income of approximately $344,000 on net revenue of approximately $734,000 in 2012.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P69_S4	In February 2012, the Company secured a $2.0 million construction loan for the expansion of the DeCordova property and an additional 34 units were constructed and completed adjacent to the first phase in August 2012.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P69_S5	The construction loan is with an unrelated third party.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P69_S6	Upon lease stabilization, the Partnership will evaluate its options in order to recoup its investment.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P70_S0	Residences at Weatherford - This property is a senior (55+) affordable housing project with 76 units located in Weatherford, Texas in the Dallas-Fort Worth area.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P70_S1	The Company acquired ownership of the property through foreclosure in February 2011.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P70_S2	In July 2011, the Company obtained a construction loan secured by the DeCordova and Weatherford properties.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P70_S3	The $6.4 million construction loan funded the completion of Weatherford and is with an unrelated third party.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P70_S4	This property was completed in April 2012 and the Partnership is operating the property as a market rate rental property.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P70_S5	Weatherford's operations resulted in recognition by the Company of net operating loss of approximately $73,000 on net revenue of approximately $255,000 in 2012.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P70_S6	The Partnership expects to operate the property as a market rate property and, upon lease stabilization, will evaluate its options in order to recoup its investment.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P71_S0	There are four properties which serve as the collateral for tax-exempt mortgage revenue bonds owned by the Partnership.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P71_S1	These tax-exempt mortgage revenue bonds are eliminated upon consolidation because 1) the Partnership previously owned the four multi-family properties prior to purchasing the tax-exempt mortgage revenue bonds and 2) the Partnership has yet to be able to recognize for accounting purposes the sale of these MF Properties in conjunction with purchasing the tax-exempt mortgage revenue bonds.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P71_S2	The limited partner owners of each of these four properties have commitments to make sufficient capital contributions that will allow for real estate sales to be recognized upon the investment by such limited partner owners.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P71_S3	The Partnership currently expects to recognize real estate sales for these four properties during 2013.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P71_S4	The following is a summary of the financial performance of these four properties:
1059142_13_ITEM7_P72_S0	Crescent Village - Crescent Village Townhomes is located in Cincinnati, Ohio and contains 90 units and was acquired in July 2007.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P72_S1	The consolidation of Crescent Village's operations resulted in recognition by the Company of net operating income of approximately $393,000 and $324,000 on net revenue of approximately $825,000 and $731,000 in 2012 and 2011 , respectively.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P72_S2	The increase in net operating income is the result of an increase in economic occupancy along with a decrease in utility and advertising expenses.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P72_S3	The property is current on the payment of principal and interest on the Partnership's bonds as of December 31, 2012 .
1059142_13_ITEM7_P73_S0	Greens of Pine Glen - Greens of Pine Glen Apartments is located in Durham, North Carolina and contain 168 units and was acquired in February 2009.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P73_S1	The Greens of Pine Glen Apartment's operations resulted in the recognition by the Company of approximately $585,000 and $588,000 of net operating income on revenue of approximately $1.39 million and $1.33 million during 2012 and 2011, respectively.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P73_S2	The decrease of net operating income is the result of an increase in salaries expenses, offset by an increase in economic occupancy.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P73_S3	The property is current on the payment of principal and interest on the Partnership's bonds as of December 31, 2012 .
1059142_13_ITEM7_P74_S0	Post Woods - Post Woods Townhomes is located in Reynoldsburg, Ohio and contains 180 units and was acquired in July 2007.

1059142_13_ITEM7_P74_S2	The decrease in net operating income is a result of an increase real estate taxes, salary and repair and maintenance expenses, offset by an increase in economic occupancy.

1059142_13_ITEM7_P75_S2	The decrease in net operating income is the result of an increase in real estate taxes and administrative expenses, offset by an increase in economic occupancy.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P75_S3	The property is current on the payment of principal and interest on the Partnership's bonds as of December 31, 2012 .
1059142_13_ITEM7_P76_S0	The tables below compare the results of operations for the Company for 2012 , 2011 , and 2010 :
1059142_13_ITEM7_P77_S0	Property revenues increased approximately $2.7 million from the addition of Eagle Village and Arboretum which was acquired after the first quarter 2011, DeCordova and Weatherford which began leasing in 2012, and Maples on 97th which was acquired in third quarter 2012.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P77_S1	Offsetting these increases was an approximate $1.1 million reduction in revenue due to the deconsolidation of Iona Lakes (which occurred in June 2011).
1059142_13_ITEM7_P77_S2	Annual net rental revenues per unit related to the MF Properties increased to $5,705 per unit in 2012 from $4,974 in 2011.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P77_S3	The annual net rental revenues per unit related to the Consolidated VIEs increased to approximately $7,064 in 2012 from approximately $6,973 in 2011.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P78_S0	Investment income increased during 2012 as compared to 2011 due to offsetting factors.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P78_S1	The increases are due to the additional tax-exempt interest payments of approximately $2.3 million from the acquisitions of the PHC Certificates, the Arbors at Hickory Ridge tax-exempt mortgage revenue bond, the MBS, and the Vantage at Judson tax-exempt mortgage revenue bond in 2012 and approximately $444,000 due to the deconsolidation of Iona Lakes in the second quarter 2011.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P78_S2	Offsetting these increases was an approximate $659,000 decrease attributable to the redemptions of Briarwood Manor Apartments and Clarkson College tax-exempt mortgage revenue bonds and approximately $230,000 due to the foreclosure of Weatherford in 2011.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P79_S0	Gain on sale and retirements of bonds.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P79_S1	Approximately $668,000 of the gain on sale and retirements of bonds is the result of the sale of the GMF-Madison Tower and GMF-Warren/Tulane tax-exempt mortgage revenue bonds in May 2012.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P79_S2	Approximately $445,000 on the gain on sale and retirements of bonds reported for fiscal 2011 is the result of the gain on the Briarwood tax-exempt mortgage revenue bond retirement during 2011.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P80_S0	Other interest income is comprised mainly of interest income on taxable loans held by the Company.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P80_S1	The decrease in other interest income is attributable to lower levels of taxable loans outstanding in 2012.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P81_S0	Approximately $555,000 reported in 2012 is the payment on a property owner promissory note received upon the restructuring of the Arbors at Hickory Ridge tax-exempt mortgage revenue bond.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P81_S1	Other income in 2011 is comprised mostly of the forgiveness of third party debt related to the DeCordova foreclosure and a $150,000 prepayment penalty received from the Foundation for Affordable Housing in third quarter 2011.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P82_S0	Real estate operating expenses associated with the MF Properties and the Consolidated VIEs is comprised principally of real estate taxes, property insurance, utilities, property management fees, repairs and maintenance, and salaries and related employee expenses of on-site employees.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P82_S1	A portion of real estate operating expenses are fixed in nature, thus a decrease in physical and economic occupancy would result in a reduction in operating margins.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P82_S2	Conversely, as physical and economic occupancy increase, the fixed nature of these expenses will increase operating margins as these real estate operating expenses would not increase at the same rate as rental revenues.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P83_S0	The overall increase in real estate operating expenses was due to various factors.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P83_S1	The Arboretum and Eagle Village properties reported approximately $507,000 of expenses which were not included in 2011, Weatherford reported approximately $328,000 of expenses as an MF Property for 2012 as it began lease-up in late March 2012, and DeCordova reported an additional approximate $129,000 due to the beginning lease-up of its 34 new units in third quarter 2012.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P83_S2	In addition, Maples on 97th Apartments and the EAT reported approximately $468,000 of acquisition and operating expenses as it was acquired in third quarter 2012.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P83_S3	The remaining increases were related to the existing VIEs and MF Properties normal operating expense increases in salaries, utilities, insurance and repair and maintenance.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P83_S4	These increases in expenses were offset by approximately $678,000 reduction in operating expenses due to the deconsolidation of Iona Lakes in 2011.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P84_S0	During 2012, two interest payments from the Woodland Park bond were received and the remaining accrued interest of approximately $452,700 has been reserved.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P84_S1	During the second quarter of 2011, an impairment of the interest receivable on the Woodland Park bond occurred and an allowance for loss of approximately $953,000 was recorded against the accrued bond interest receivable in 2011.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P85_S0	During 2011, the Company recorded an allowance against the Iona Lakes taxable loan.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P85_S1	No such provisions for loan losses were recorded against taxable loans during 2012.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P86_S0	Depreciation and amortization consists primarily of depreciation associated with the apartment properties of the Consolidated VIEs and the MF Properties, amortization associated with in-place lease intangible assets recorded as part of the purchase accounting for the acquisition of MF Properties and deferred finance cost amortization related to the closing of the TEBS and TOB Credit Facilities.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P86_S1	The increase in depreciation and amortization expense from the 2011 to 2012 is related to approximately $1.3 million from the Arboretum property (acquired on March 31, 2011), the Eagle Village property acquired at the end of June 2011, the additional depreciation recorded once the Weatherford and DeCordova's construction was completed and placed in service in second and third quarter 2012, and the acquisition of Maples on 97th acquired in third quarter of 2012.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P86_S2	Offsetting this increase is the approximate $317,000 decrease in depreciation and amortization expense due to the deconsolidation of Iona Lakes in second quarter 2011.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P87_S0	The increase in interest expense during 2012 compared to 2011 was due to offsetting factors.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P87_S1	The Company's borrowing cost remained at approximately 2.7% per annum for both 2011 and 2012.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P87_S2	However, the Company realized approximately $1.2 million increase in interest expense as a result of the higher average principal of outstanding debt in 2012 as compared to 2011.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P87_S3	Offsetting this increase was the approximate $1.1 million decrease from the mark to market adjustment of the Company's derivatives.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P87_S4	These interest rate derivatives do not qualify for hedge accounting and, accordingly, they are carried at fair value, with changes in fair value included in current period earnings within interest expense.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P88_S0	The increase in general and administrative expenses is mainly due to incentive compensation, increases in administrative fees due to the purchase of PHC Certificates and MBS and increases in professional fees.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P89_S0	Property revenues increased mainly as a result of additional MF Properties.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P89_S1	The Arboretum was acquired on March 31, 2011, and added approximately $1.8 million to property revenues during 2011.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P90_S0	Eagle Village was acquired on June 29, 2011 and added approximately $945,000 to property revenues in 2011.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P90_S1	Partially offsetting this increase was an approximately $1.4 million decrease in revenue due to the deconsolidation of Iona Lakes.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P90_S2	The remaining increase is primarily attributable to the increased economic occupancy at the existing MF Properties year over year.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P90_S3	Annual net rental revenues per unit related to the MF Properties decreased to $4,974 per unit in 2011 from $6,369 in 2010.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P90_S4	This was due to the acqusition of the Eagle Village student housing project which was acquired in 2011.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P90_S5	The annual net rental revenues per unit related to the Consolidated VIEs increased to approximately $6,973 in 2011 from approximately $6,888 in 2010.

1059142_13_ITEM7_P91_S2	Interest payments of approximately $1.9 million were received from tax-exempt mortgage revenue bonds that the Company did not hold during 2010.

1059142_13_ITEM7_P91_S4	In addition, the Company realized approximately $308,000 of contingent interest from the Clarkson College bond retirement in second quarter 2011.

1059142_13_ITEM7_P95_S2	The early extinguishment of this debt resulted in a gain of approximately $435,000 in 2010.

1059142_13_ITEM7_P98_S2	In 2010, approximately $212,000 was recorded against the Woodland Park taxable loan and $350,000 was recorded against the cross collateralized Ashley Square and Cross Creek taxable loans as an allowance for bad debt and an associated provision for loan loss.

1059142_13_ITEM7_P99_S1	The resulting charge was attributable to the unitholders.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P99_S2	In February 2011, the Company completed foreclosure proceedings on the bond issued on this property and now owns the property directly.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P99_S3	No impairment charges were recorded on this project in 2011.

1059142_13_ITEM7_P110_S0	Real estate operating expenses associated with the MF Properties is comprised principally of real estate taxes, property insurance, utilities, property management fees, repairs and maintenance, and salaries and related employee expenses of on-site employees.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P110_S1	A portion of real estate operating expenses are fixed in nature, thus a decrease in physical and economic occupancy would result in a reduction in operating margins.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P110_S2	Conversely, as physical and economic occupancy increase, the fixed nature of these expenses will increase operating margins as these real estate operating expenses would not increase at the same rate as rental revenues.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P111_S0	The overall increase in real estate operating expenses was due to various factors.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P111_S1	The Arboretum and Eagle Village properties reported approximately $507,000 of expenses which were not included in 2011, Weatherford reported approximately $328,000 of expenses as an MF Property for 2012 as it began lease-up in late March 2012, and DeCordova reported an additional approximate $129,000 due to the beginning lease-up of its 34 new units in third quarter 2012.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P111_S2	In addition, Maples on 97th Apartments reported approximately $243,000 of acquisition and operating expenses as it was acquired in third quarter 2012.
1059142_13_ITEM7_P111_S3	The remaining increases were related to the existing MF Properties normal operating expense increases in salaries, utilities, insurance and repair and maintenance.

1059142_13_ITEM7_P126_S0	Depreciation and amortization consists primarily of depreciation associated with the MF Properties, amortization associated with in-place lease intangible assets recorded as part of the purchase accounting for the acquisition of MF Properties and deferred finance cost amortization related to the closing of the TEBS and TOB Credit Facilities.

1059142_13_ITEM7_P127_S2	Offsetting this decrease was an approximate $1.5 million increase resulting from the higher average principal of outstanding debt.
